snippet: The N.F.L. draft looms large for the Jets. Their needs are so plentiful that it is feasible they will use their first-round pick, No. 9 over all, for a number of positions.
abstract: NFL draft is set to begin and all eyes will be on New York Jets general manager John Idzik, who will try to reload roster that last season lacked depth and quality in a draft that could accelerate the team's return to respectability; Idzik does not feel pressure to make the right play in what could be a franchise-changing decision--potential trade of star cornerback Darelle Revis.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. draft looms large for the Jets. Their needs are so plentiful that it is feasible they will use their first-round pick, No. 9 over all, for a number of positions.

headline.seo: Before They Add Players, Jets Must Decide Which of Theirs They’ll Keep
headline.main: Before Adding Players, Jets Face a Tough Call
headline.print_headline: Before Adding Players, Jets Face a Tough Call
